title: High Political Stability and Low Violence
description: In 2023, Mexico reported a high number of sources (9) for political stability and a low standard error (0.205) in the absence of violence and terrorism, indicating a relatively stable political environment.

title: Minimal Export Taxation
description: In 2022, taxes on exports constituted an almost negligible percentage (0.0000013%) of Mexico's total tax revenue, reflecting a minimal burden on export activities.

title: Significant Unpaid Domestic Work by Women
description: In 2019, Mexican women spent approximately 27.77% of their day on unpaid domestic and care work, highlighting a significant gender disparity in household responsibilities.

title: Low Net Financial Inflows from Multilateral Sources
description: In 2023, Mexico experienced a substantial negative net financial flow from multilateral sources, amounting to -$1.83 billion, indicating a net outflow of funds.

title: Negative Net Financial Flows from IBRD
description: Mexico recorded a negative net financial flow of -$1.21 billion from the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) in 2023, suggesting more funds were repaid than received.

title: Low Net Financial Flows from RDB Nonconcessional Sources
description: In 2023, Mexico's net financial flows from regional development banks (RDB) nonconcessional sources were negative, totaling -$525.94 million, indicating a net outflow of funds.

title: Minimal Arms Exports
description: In 2019, Mexico's arms exports were valued at 1,000,000 SIPRI trend indicator values, reflecting a relatively low level of arms trade activity.

title: Effective Diarrhea Treatment for Children
description: In 2015, 79.9% of children under 5 in Mexico received oral rehydration and continued feeding for diarrhea treatment, indicating effective healthcare practices in this area.
